verses.plain: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

tokens.t: Give ear, O my people,
my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.plain: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

tokens.t: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

verses.plain: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

tokens.t: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

verses.plain: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

tokens.t: We will not hide
from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the
, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

verses.plain: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

tokens.t: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

verses.plain: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

tokens.t: That the generation to come might know
the children
should be born;
should arise and declare
to their children:

verses.plain: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

tokens.t: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

verses.plain: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

tokens.t: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation
set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

verses.plain: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

tokens.t: The children of Ephraim,
armed,
carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

verses.plain: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

tokens.t: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

verses.plain: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

tokens.t: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

verses.plain: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

tokens.t: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt,
the field of Zoan.

verses.plain: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

tokens.t: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

verses.plain: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

tokens.t: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

verses.plain: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

tokens.t: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave
drink as
the great depths.

verses.plain: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

tokens.t: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

verses.plain: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

tokens.t: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

verses.plain: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

tokens.t: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

verses.plain: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

tokens.t: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

verses.plain: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

tokens.t: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

verses.plain: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

tokens.t: Therefore the
heard
, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

verses.plain: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

tokens.t: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

verses.plain: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

tokens.t: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

verses.plain: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

tokens.t: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

verses.plain: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

tokens.t: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

verses.plain: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

tokens.t: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

verses.plain: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

tokens.t: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

verses.plain: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

tokens.t: And he let
fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

verses.plain: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

tokens.t: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

verses.plain: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

tokens.t: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat
yet in their mouths,

verses.plain: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

tokens.t: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen
of Israel.

verses.plain: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

tokens.t: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

verses.plain: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

tokens.t: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

verses.plain: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

tokens.t: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

verses.plain: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

tokens.t: And they remembered that God
their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

verses.plain: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

tokens.t: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

verses.plain: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

tokens.t: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

verses.plain: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

tokens.t: But he,
full of compassion, forgave
iniquity, and destroyed
not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

verses.plain: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

tokens.t: For he remembered that they
flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verses.plain: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

tokens.t: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness,
grieve him in the desert!

verses.plain: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

tokens.t: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

verses.plain: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

tokens.t: They remembered not his hand,
the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

verses.plain: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

tokens.t: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

verses.plain: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

tokens.t: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

verses.plain: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

tokens.t: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

verses.plain: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

tokens.t: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

verses.plain: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

tokens.t: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

verses.plain: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

tokens.t: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

verses.plain: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

tokens.t: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels

verses.plain: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

tokens.t: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verses.plain: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

tokens.t: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of
strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

verses.plain: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

tokens.t: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.plain: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

tokens.t: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verses.plain: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

tokens.t: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,
this mountain,
his right hand had purchased.

verses.plain: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

tokens.t: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.plain: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

tokens.t: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

verses.plain: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

tokens.t: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

verses.plain: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

tokens.t: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

verses.plain: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

tokens.t: When God heard
, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

verses.plain: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

tokens.t: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent
he placed among men;

verses.plain: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

tokens.t: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.plain: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

tokens.t: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.plain: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

tokens.t: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verses.plain: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

tokens.t: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

verses.plain: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

tokens.t: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,
like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

verses.plain: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

tokens.t: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

verses.plain: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

tokens.t: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

verses.plain: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

tokens.t: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

verses.plain: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

tokens.t: And he built his sanctuary like high
, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

verses.plain: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

tokens.t: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

verses.plain: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

tokens.t: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.plain: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

tokens.t: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

footnotes.text: Maschil…: or, A Psalm for Asaph to give instruction
that…: Heb. that prepared not their heart
Man…: or, Every one did eat the bread of the mighty
He made…: Heb. He weighed a path
life…: or, beasts to the murrain
